intro: Gentianella pleurogynoides subsp. pleurogynoides, commonly known as the pleurogynoides gentian, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous grasslands and open woodlands. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
